intro: Heracleum sibiricum f. rarum, commonly known as the rare Siberian hogweed, is a variant of the Siberian hogweed species. It is a biennial or perennial herb that can grow up to 2 meters tall, characterized by its large, lobed leaves and showy white flower clusters. The plant belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is native to parts of Asia. It is known for its toxic sap, which can cause severe skin irritation upon contact. This rare form is less commonly found in the wild compared to the standard species.
